meanings.definition: A mass meeting of people making a political protest or showing support for a cause.
meanings.sent1: The community organized a rally to support the new library.
meanings.sent2: The rally in the park drew a large crowd of supporters.
meanings.sent3: At the rally, everyone cheered and waved signs.
meanings.sent4: The rally was a sea of colorful banners and passionate speeches.
meanings.sent5: The rally left a lasting impression on all who attended.

meanings.definition: A recovery or improvement in strength or spirits after a setback.
meanings.sent1: After the tough loss, the team's rally in the next game was impressive.
meanings.sent2: Her positive attitude was a key factor in her rally from illness.
meanings.sent3: The rally in morale lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent4: His determination sparked a remarkable rally in performance.
meanings.sent5: The rally in energy was evident in their renewed enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: To come together for a common purpose or cause.
meanings.sent1: The community rallies to clean up the park every month.
meanings.sent2: People rallied around the family in their time of need.
meanings.sent3: The team rallied together to win the championship.
meanings.sent4: Neighbors rallied to support the local business.
meanings.sent5: The town rallied behind the mayor's new initiative.

meanings.definition: To recover or improve after a setback.
meanings.sent1: She rallied quickly after the surgery and was back on her feet.
meanings.sent2: The stock market rallied after the initial drop.
meanings.sent3: The team rallied from behind to secure the victory.
meanings.sent4: His determination helped him rally from the disappointing defeat.
meanings.sent5: The community rallied together to rebuild after the storm.
